about.summary: Collection of baseline correction algorithms, along with a framework and a GUI for optimising baseline algorithm parameters. Typical use of the package is for removing background effects from spectra originating from various types of spectroscopy and spectrometry, possibly optimizing this with regard to regression or classification results. Correction methods include polynomial fitting, weighted local smoothers and many more.

Collection of baseline correction algorithms, along with a framework and a GUI for optimising baseline algorithm parameters. Typical use of the package is for removing background effects from spectra originating from various types of spectroscopy and spectrometry, possibly optimizing this with regard to regression or classification results. Correction methods include polynomial fitting, weighted local smoothers and many more.

name: r-baseline
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.3-7" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-baseline
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/baseline_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/baseline/baseline_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: cab4794e20656054a01bb30c8c67df5baffb81bd172a69a435d2cb36f748bcec

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-sparsem
    - r-limsolve
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-sparsem
    - r-limsolve

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('baseline')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('baseline')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=baseline
  license: GPL-2
  summary: Collection of baseline correction algorithms, along with a framework and a GUI for optimising baseline algorithm parameters. Typical use of the package is for removing background effects from spectra originating from various types of spectroscopy and spectrometry, possibly optimizing this with regard to regression
    or classification results. Correction methods include polynomial fitting, weighted local smoothers and many more.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Encoding: UTF-8

# Maintainer: Kristian Hovde Liland <kristian.liland@nmbu.no>
# Description: Collection of baseline correction algorithms, along with a framework and a GUI for optimising baseline algorithm parameters. Typical use of the package is for removing background effects from spectra originating from various types of spectroscopy and spectrometry, possibly optimizing this with regard to regression or classification results. Correction methods include polynomial fitting, weighted local smoothers and many more.
# License: GPL-2
# Depends: R (>= 2.15)
# Imports: graphics, SparseM, grDevices, stats, methods, limSolve
